Post - Class in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.model.entity
Post entity in the database to store information regarding the posts users can make to the community wall.
Post() - Constructor for class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.model.entity.Post
 
PostController - Class in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller
REST Controller class for Post to receive parameter values taken from HTTP requests to their respective specified URL endpoints, and returning serialized JSON object results to HTTP responses.
PostController(PostService) - Constructor for class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller.PostController
Constructor for creating an instance of PostService
PostRepository - Interface in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.model.dao
The PostRepository extends the JpaRepository, which provides the CRUD (create, read, update, delete) functions, as well as providing the ability to delete records in batches.
PostService - Class in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service
A Service class for the Post entity that participates in dependency injection, and performs more detailed methods for obtaining information for the PostController and PostRepository.
PostService(PostRepository, StorageService) - Constructor for class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service.PostService
Creates an instance of PostRepository
PowdrApplication - Class in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr
The main class for the Powdr webservice that allows the server to run through Spring.
PowdrApplication() - Constructor for class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.PowdrApplication
 
Preloader - Class in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service
Class to preload data into the database.
Preloader(SkiResortRepository, MessageRepository) - Constructor for class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.service.Preloader
Constructs an instance of Preloader.
PreloadLauncher - Class in edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr
Configuration class to preload data into the database.
PreloadLauncher() - Constructor for class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.PreloadLauncher
 
putImage(MultipartFile, Authentication) - Method in class edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller.UserController
Stores uploaded file content as an Image alongside the User who uploaded it.
